title: Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 43 (Pollution
description:
Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 43 (Pollution, Environment Disasters):

We have 25 titles in this upload. They discuss man-made disasters that had grave impact on the environment. Corporate greed and human errors are the major culprits in most of the crimes committed against mother Earth.

-  Blackwell - Visit Sunny Chernobyl and Other Adventures in the World's Most Polluted Places (2012)

-  Booth - The Environmental Consequences of Growth; Steady-State Economics as an Alternative to Ecological Decline (1998)

-  Final Report on the Investigation of the Macondo Well Blowout, Deep Water Study Group, March1, 2011

-  Fortun - Advocacy after Bhopal; Environmentalism, Disaster, New Global Orders (2001)

-  Frickel - Chemical Consequences; Environmental Mutagens, Scientist Activism, and the Rise of Genetic Toxicology (2004)

-  Holand - Offshore Blowouts; Causes and Control (1997)

-  Iversen - Full Body Burden; Growing Up in the Nuclear Shadow of Rocky Flats (2012)

-  Juhasz - Black Tide; the Devastating Impact of the Gulf Oil Spill (2011)

-  Kletz - What Went Wrong; Case Histories of Process Plant Disasters and How They Could Have Been Avoided (2009)

-  Kostianoy & Lavrova (Eds.) - Oil Pollution in the Baltic Sea (2014)

-  Macondo Well Deepwater Horizon Blowout; Lessons for Improving Offshore Drilling Safety (NAE & NAS, 2012)

-  Mahaffey - Atomic Accidents; a History of Nuclear Meltdown and Disasters from the Ozark Mountains to Fukushima (2014)

-  Mara - The Chernobyl Disaster; Legacy and Impact on the Future of Nuclear Energy (2011)

-  Mukherjee - Surviving Bhopal; Dancing Bodies, Written Texts, and Oral Testimonials of Women in an Industrial Disaster (2010)

-  Nikiforuk - Tar Sands; Dirty Oil and the Future of a Continent (2010)

-  Ochiai - Hiroshima to Fukushima; Biohazards of Radiation (2014)

-  Oil in the Sea III; Inputs, Fates, and Effects (NRC, 2003)

-  Petryna - Life Exposed; Biological Citizens after Chernobyl (2002)

-  Potters - Marine Pollution (2013)

-  Povinec et  al - Fukushima Accident; Radioactivity Impact on the Environment (2013)

-  Price - The Orphaned Land; New Mexico's Environment Since the Manhattan Project (2011)

-  Read - BP and the Macondo Spill; The Complete Story (2011)

-  Stern - The Buffalo Creek Disaster (1976)

-  Vallero - Unraveling Environmental Disasters (2013)

Note that more titles about the this topic were uploaded within collection 5 of this series.
